intro: Goeppertia cantagallana, commonly known as the silver queen calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves with silver and green patterns. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and requires moderate humidity to maintain its vibrant foliage. It is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value. Goeppertia cantagallana prefers well-draining soil and should be watered regularly but allowed to dry slightly between waterings.
